title: segfault with a typaram constraint on a struct

labels.name: I-crash
labels.description: Issue: The compiler crashes (SIGSEGV, SIGABRT, etc). Use I-ICE instead when the compiler panics.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
I ran into a segfault putting a constrained type parameter on a struct. Here's a creduce example. Oddly enough, that single `' '` indent is significant:

``` rust
trait ToIdent {}
struct Ctx;
 fn builder<'a, T: ToIdent>(ctx: &'a Ctx, name: T) -> ArgBuilder { }
struct ArgBuilder<T: Fn()>;
fn main() {}
```

compiling this with `rustc 0.13.0-nightly (96a3c7c6a 2014-12-23 22:21:10 +0000)` on OS X, I get:

```
bad.rs:3:55: 3:65 error: wrong number of type arguments: expected 1, found 0
bad.rs:3  fn builder<'a, T: ToIdent>(ctx: &'a Ctx, name: T) -> ArgBuilder { }
                                                               ^~~~~~~~~~
Process 39948 stopped
* thread #2: tid = 0x25c788, 0x00000001038ee296 libstd-4e7c5e5c.dylib`je_arena_dalloc_bin_locked + 374, stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=EXC_I386_GPFLT)
    frame #0: 0x00000001038ee296 libstd-4e7c5e5c.dylib`je_arena_dalloc_bin_locked + 374
libstd-4e7c5e5c.dylib`je_arena_dalloc_bin_locked + 374:
-> 0x1038ee296:  movq   0x20(%r8,%rsi,8), %rax
   0x1038ee29b:  movl   $0x1, %edx
   0x1038ee2a0:  shlq   %cl, %rdx
   0x1038ee2a3:  xorq   %rax, %rdx
(lldb) bt
* thread #2: tid = 0x25c788, 0x00000001038ee296 libstd-4e7c5e5c.dylib`je_arena_dalloc_bin_locked + 374, stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=EXC_I386_GPFLT)
  * frame #0: 0x00000001038ee296 libstd-4e7c5e5c.dylib`je_arena_dalloc_bin_locked + 374
    frame #1: 0x0000000103918501 libstd-4e7c5e5c.dylib`je_tcache_bin_flush_small + 241
    frame #2: 0x00000001039190d0 libstd-4e7c5e5c.dylib`je_tcache_cleanup + 80
    frame #3: 0x000000010391950f libstd-4e7c5e5c.dylib`je_tsd_cleanup + 159
    frame #4: 0x000000010391993a libstd-4e7c5e5c.dylib`je_tsd_cleanup_wrapper + 26
    frame #5: 0x00007fff8f62d7be libsystem_pthread.dylib`_pthread_tsd_cleanup + 86
    frame #6: 0x00007fff8f62d4e5 libsystem_pthread.dylib`_pthread_exit + 117
    frame #7: 0x00007fff8f62c307 libsystem_pthread.dylib`_pthread_body + 142
    frame #8: 0x00007fff8f62c279 libsystem_pthread.dylib`_pthread_start + 176
    frame #9: 0x00007fff8f62a4b1 libsystem_pthread.dylib`thread_start + 13
```
